bibl.title: The World Turned Upside Down. Utopia and Utopianism in the Fragments of Old Comedy.
bibl.note: Paper given at the Conference of the same name, University of Wales, Institute of Classics and Ancient History, and London Classical Society, September 1996. - L'évocation de l'âge d'or dans Cratinos, Cratès, Télécleidès, Eupolis et autres. - Non vidimus. Cf. APh 76 (2007) No. 7737.

bibl.title: The Rivals of Aristophanes. Studies in Athenian Old Comedy

bibl.seg: RUFFELL Ian A., The World Turned Upside Down. Utopia and Utopianism in the Fragments of Old Comedy.
David HARVEY and John WILKINS (Edd.), The Rivals of Aristophanes. Studies in Athenian Old Comedy (London, 2000) pp. 473-506.

Paper given at the Conference of the same name, University of Wales, Institute of Classics and Ancient History, and London Classical Society, September 1996. - L'évocation de l'âge d'or dans Cratinos, Cratès, Télécleidès, Eupolis et autres. - Non vidimus. Cf. APh 76 (2007) No. 7737.
